i think riot wouldnt like that the additional quests remove the strong focus on the actual gameplay and the REAL quest of destroying their nexus. like if nasus was focusing on stacking at top, and he notices renekton is at bot lane, whether by TP or by walking down there, or they're in different roles, despite stacking potentially being the best thing to do at that moment, if there was a quest for him and nasus to kill each other, and 1 player (the nasus) took the quest more seriously than the renekton (who doesnt stack) the team with the nasus now have an additional reason not to win by nasus not playing to his full potential by chasing after a pointless quest

if there was a reward for the quest like the head of khazix one, it might seem like.....then it kind of becomes forced, if there were just too many quests especially with rewards, its so much harder to keep track of just how strong everyone really is which is very important especially in higher elos. at a certain point it might become random/RNG where everyones running around with invisible buffs. speaking of buffs, these would definitely be buffs that riot would need to keep in line which is something they probably wouldnt wanna have to deal with
